@graph.name: Importing Collections via CSV - Optizen Tutorial
@graph.description: Learn how to bulk update your collections by importing a CSV file into Shopify using Optizen. Perfect for large-scale content updates or migrating from another platform.

about.name: CSV Collection Import Process
about.description: Bulk importing collection data into Shopify using CSV files

@graph.transcript: In this tutorial, we'll walk through the process of importing collections via CSV. First, prepare your CSV file with the correct format including collection handle, title, description, and SEO fields. Then navigate to the Optizen dashboard, select the import function, and upload your file. The system will validate your data and show a preview before importing.

@graph.headline: Importing Collections via CSV - Optizen Support Documentation
@graph.description: Complete guide to bulk updating collections by importing CSV files into Shopify using Optizen. Includes CSV format requirements and step-by-step import process.
teaches: CSV file format for collection imports

@graph.name: How to Import Collections via CSV in Optizen
@graph.description: Step-by-step process for bulk importing collection data using CSV files

supply.name: Collection data in proper CSV format

step.name: Prepare CSV File
step.text: Create or format your CSV file with required columns: handle, title, description, meta_title, meta_description, and other collection fields.

step.name: Access Import Function
step.text: Navigate to your Optizen dashboard and locate the Collections section. Click on the Import button to access the CSV upload interface.

step.name: Upload CSV File
step.text: Select your prepared CSV file and upload it to the system. The platform will automatically validate the file format and data structure.

step.name: Review and Confirm
step.text: Review the import preview showing how many collections will be created or updated. Confirm the import to begin processing your data.

step.name: Monitor Import Progress
step.text: Track the import progress and review any error messages. Once complete, verify that your collections have been successfully imported into Shopify.

@graph.name: CSV Collection Import Training
@graph.description: Educational resource for learning bulk collection import processes in Optizen
assesses: Ability to format CSV files correctly

mainEntity.name: What CSV format is required for importing collections?

acceptedAnswer.text: The CSV file should include columns for handle, title, description, meta_title, meta_description, and any custom fields. The first row should contain column headers, and each subsequent row represents a collection.

mainEntity.name: How many collections can I import at once?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can import up to 1000 collections in a single CSV file. For larger imports, split your data into multiple files and import them sequentially.

mainEntity.name: What happens if there are errors in my CSV file?

acceptedAnswer.text: The system will validate your CSV and show any errors before importing. Common issues include missing required fields, invalid handles, or formatting problems. You can fix these issues and re-upload the corrected file.

mainEntity.name: Can I update existing collections with CSV import?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, if a collection with the same handle already exists, the import will update that collection with the new data from your CSV file.

mainEntity.name: How long does the import process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Import time depends on the number of collections and data complexity. Typically, 100 collections take 2-3 minutes to process. You'll see a progress indicator during the import.
